[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Mahjong Learning System (MLS) defines requirements for interactive Mahjong tutorials, multiplayer gameplay, and rule adherence.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: MLS supports real-time rule access, guided gameplay training, and matchmaking for players of all skill levels.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: MLS integrates with Mahjong servers, multiplayer chat services, and rulebook databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: MLS provides web-based and mobile-friendly dashboards for players and administrators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: MLS operates on desktops, tablets, and smartphones.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: MLS supports REST APIs for gameplay tutorials, leaderboards, and matchmaking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: MLS ensures secure multiplayer sessions using TCP/IP (IPv6) communication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: MLS optimizes caching for low-latency rule access and game data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: MLS ensures 24/7 availability with scheduled maintenance and live updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: MLS supports configurable Mahjong rule sets based on regional variations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: MLS connects to analytics platforms and game moderation tools.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: MLS facilitates Mahjong tutorials, multiplayer gameplay, and real-time rule enforcement.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for players, coaches, and game administrators with varying Mahjong expertise.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: MLS depends on stable internet connectivity and compliant multiplayer servers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: MLS requires operational rulebook APIs, user authentication services, and IPv6-compatible infrastructure.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with Mahjong server APIs for multiplayer functionality.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall connect to rulebook APIs for real-time rule access.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall provide interactive Mahjong tutorials with AI feedback and progression tracking (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall support multiplayer matchmaking, ranked games, and auto-disconnect handling (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The interface shall offer guided workflows for learning Mahjong gameplay.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall support multilingual functionality.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process multiplayer actions with a 3-second response time.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to 1,000 concurrent players.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store player profiles, rule configurations, and game history.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall support role-based access and high-speed queries.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall adhere to modular architecture principles for scalability.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The software shall comply with Mahjong rulebook APIs.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall meet GDPR requirements for user data privacy.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall adhere to TCP/IP IPv6 communication standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall scale dynamically, optimizing server resources for peak loads.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall log critical events for audits.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Gameplay tutorials, multiplayer functionality, and rule compliance.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, setup manuals, and API developer documentation.
[SEC] 5. References: Mahjong rulebooks, TCP/IP IPv6 documentation, and GDPR docs.
